content:
Jubilee said:

I do acknowledge Travis has gradually degraded towards being... unsuitable for our or anyone else's requirements, at least in FOSSware.

Yeah. IIRC the Rust project has a PowerPC machine that can be used for CI, if not you could probably ask https://osuosl.org/services/powerdev/

native with power9/power9-vector

thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'failed to spawn thread: Os { code: 11, kind: WouldBlock, message: "Resource temporarily unavailable" }', /rustc/48691ea6e639640f110b43e33d4aba1f07e7415c/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/back/write.rs:1689:10
note: run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display a backtrace
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md
note: rustc 1.53.0-nightly (48691ea6e 2021-03-29) running on powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu
note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C target-cpu=native
note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
query stack during panic:
end of query stack

power8/altivec only:

thread 'main' panicked at 'failed to spawn scoped thread: Os { code: 11, kind: WouldBlock, message: "Resource temporarily unavailable" }', /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/crossbeam-utils-0.8.0/src/thread.rs:255:14
note: run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display a backtrace
